channel.title: magnets on Konigi
channel.description: Recent content in magnets on Konigi

item.title: Konigi DIY Wireframe Magnets
item.description: The Konigi DIY Wireframe Magnet Kit is based on the wireframe stencils and includes 3 sheets of elements that might be useful in whiteboard prototyping. Simply download and print the PDFs onto magnet sheets. They were designed and tested for use with Avery 3270 Printable Magnet Sheets for Inkjet Printers. Lamination is also recommended so they're usable with dry-erase markers. Enjoy! //konigi.com/tools/wireframe-magnets-diy-kit

item.title: Playing with DIY UI Magnets
item.description: I'm experimenting with making magnets of some of the elements of the Wireframe Stencil to use for prototyping. Was an interesting experiment printing and cutting these. Next time I think I'll have to laminate the sheet first, and then cut. The lamination might make it possible to write on them with dry erase marker. If you write directly on the magnet sheets the ink will stay permanently I'd think.

item.title: Create Your Own Magnetic Prototype
item.description: Adaptive Path's Alexa Andrzejewski suggests how to create your own magnetic prototypes using printable magnets for user interface elements. Good stuff. Customizable and inexpensive. http://www.adaptivepath.com/blog/2008/11/17/magneticprototyping/
